title: Thai Green Curry Chicken
ingredients: 2 cilantro roots or 4 big cilantro stems
instructions:
1. Reduce 0.75 cup coconut milk until thick and coconut oil starts to separate.
2. Add curry paste and sauté for about 2 minutes until aromatic.
3. Add chicken thigh and stir to mix.
4. Add chicken stock, remaining coconut milk, palm sugar, fish sauce, and makrut lime leaves (bruise and tear into chunks, discard stems). Bring to simmer and cook 10-15 minutes until chicken is tender.
5. Add bamboo shoots and bring to boil. Add red bell pepper if desired. Remove from heat.
6. Taste and adjust fish sauce and sugar as needed. If curry is weak, sauté additional curry paste in oil and add back.
7. Add Thai basil and stir until wilted. Serve with jasmine rice.

For chicken breast: After sautéing curry paste, add makrut lime leaves, coconut milk, chicken stock, palm sugar, and fish sauce; simmer 5 minutes. Add marinated chicken breast and cook 1-2 minutes until 70% done. Add bamboo shoots and bring to boil. Add peppers if desired. Remove from heat. Adjust seasoning. Add Thai basil and serve with jasmine rice.

For curry paste: Toast cumin and coriander seeds. Grind with white peppercorns. Prepare chilies by removing seeds from some. Pound chilies and salt into paste. Add basil leaves, lemongrass, galangal, lime zest, cilantro roots, shallots, garlic, and shrimp paste; pound into fine paste.
